docs.snippet: Soft Serve scans newspapers, magazines and Web sites for "soft news" - coverage of products, trends and matters of style. Just the fluff, ma'am. And the Oscar goes to... Soft Serve! We may be jealous of last night's winners and their golden statue...
docs.lead_paragraph: Soft Serve scans newspapers, magazines and Web sites for "soft news" - coverage of products, trends and matters of style. Just the fluff, ma'am.And the Oscar goes to... Soft Serve! We may be jealous of last night's winners and their golden statuettes, but the Oscar swag is decidedly lackluster since going green: toe pillows, doggie GPS, and mini-kegs... Sparkling Vodka? Now there's a cutting-edge beverage that should have made the cut... We'd like to be nominated for an opening night drink at The Standard New York. Andre Balazs' to-be-completed hotel will have a bar on the 18th floor... Speaking of killer views, Agent Provocateur recently staged a scantily clad model in the windows at Selfridges for the launch of its new fragrance, aptly named "Strip"... Looking to draw the blinds? Magnetic curtains will chicly shield you from prying eyes... JFK was not the poster boy for discretion, but his Omega timepiece certainly had an understated elegance. Snatch up a limited edition commemorative replica for $8,250... New York Magazine's Best Bets has some unconventional options for keeping time. Go for the old-school glam of a wood block LED or turn up the heat on an old clock and "bedeck it with glowing color"... Keep the colder elements and dirt off your car with wiperless windshields... If you're a fan of getting dirty, Detergent T-shirts will only reveal their true intentions after you've thrown them in the wash... Soft Serve is throwing in the towel. Check out our fluffy goodness again tomorrow.
docs.abstract: Soft Serve scans newspapers, magazines and Web sites for "soft news" - coverage of products, trends and matters of style. Just the fluff, ma'am. And the Oscar goes to... Soft Serve! We may be jealous of last night's winners and their golden statuettes, but the Oscar swag is decidedly lackluster since going green: toe pillows, [...]

headline.main: Soft Serve | Bubbly Vodka, Stripping for a New Scent, Dress a Clock in Neon

docs.snippet: After the winners and losers, some industry bigwigs share some thoughts about Hollywood....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bagger was very busy stuffing crab claws and shrimp into his baggie-lined pockets at the Governor's Ball last night, but did actually have a notebook in there as well. He discovered that the growing cosmopolitanism of a traditionally ingrown industry is good for the business, filmgoers and the movies themselves.
docs.abstract: After the winners and losers, some industry bigwigs share some thoughts about Hollywood.

docs.snippet: Room for 98 others, but not Brad Renfro....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Oscar's ceremony last night included a feature honoring people who died in the past year, but one of the most prominent deaths in the past year was not included. But the Academy told TMZ.com said that the decision had nothing to do with the way Brad Renfro, 25, died (heroin overdose) or the quality of his work ("The Client," "Apt Pupil").
docs.abstract: Room for 98 others, but not Brad Renfro.

headline.main: Odd Man Out of Oscar Tribute

docs.snippet: How did the Academy Awards hold up? We identified Oscar viewers across the country using the social messaging site Twitter and asked some of them to size up the show....
docs.lead_paragraph: The 80th annual Academy Awards were produced under a palpable sense of pressure. The host, Jon Stewart, had little time to prepare material due to the writers' strike, and the executive producer, Gil Cates, had lengthy clip reels ready in case the actors didn't show up.
docs.abstract: How did the Academy Awards hold up? We identified Oscar viewers across the country using the social messaging site Twitter and asked some of them to size up the show.

headline.main: You Decode: The 80th Annual Academy Awards
